fields.name: Serpent People
fields.special: Abilities: Cold Blooded, Earth Sense, Venomous (RQ6: pg 312-316)

fields.name: Zombie
fields.special: Abilities: Undead (page 316). Immune to the effects of serious wounds. Major wounds do not incapacitate Rq6 pg 397

fields.name: Vampire
fields.special: Abilities: Allergy (Sunlight), Darksight, Gaze Attack (Domination), Immunity (Mundane Weapons), Undead, Vampiric, Vulnerable(Special)  (Rq6 page 316). Immune to the effects of serious wounds. Major wounds do not incapacitate RQ6 pg 393-394

fields.name: Scorpion Man
fields.special: Chaotic feature chance POW x 5.  RQ6 pg 441-442.  Adhere.

fields.name: Ghoul
fields.special: Abilities: Undead, Death Sense, Regeneration (Rq6 page 316). Immune to the effects of serious wounds. Major wounds do not incapacitate. RQ6 pg 366

fields.name: Giant Octopus
fields.special: Camouflaged, Formidable Natural Weapons, Grappler, Multi-limbed, Regeneration, Swimmer, Venomous RQ6 pg 379

fields.notes: Up to 1/3 POW in devotional pool. Indoril Armour.
fields.name: Ordinator
Radiates Fear. All creatures within 15m of this horrifying creature must make a successful resistance roll of their INT vs their own POW or flee

Acidic - Possesses a flesh dissolving acidic ichor which sprays whenever the skin is damaged, causing damage to the attacker; roll 1d4 to determine the strength of the acid, 1=1d2, 2=1d4, 3=1d6 and 4=1d8 damage per wound.
Alluring - Produces pheromones which attract and seduce victims. The creature gains the Seduction skill at POW x5%. It can be resisted using Willpower as per any Seduction.
Asymmetric - One half of the creature is larger, longer or taller than the other, double the Hit Points for locations in the larger side and halve the Hit Points of locations for the smaller.
Boneless - The creature possesses resilient, malleable cartilage rather than bone. It can squeeze through any size of gap and takes no damage from any fall.
Brainless - Sensory organs are distributed over the entire body and sentience is located elsewhere – but not in the head. The brain is found in a random location.
Burning - The creature seethes with chaotic heat, injuring anyone within Short range; roll a d4, 1=1d2, 2=1d4, 3=1d6 and 4=1d8 damage per round.
Chameleon - Naturally blends with its surroundings and has an effective Stealth skill of 100%+POW.
Contagious - Inflicts a virulent disease with a delay of 1d8 hours and potency of CONx5%, which reduces a random characteristic by1d8 points: roll a d6, 1=STR, 2=CON, 3=DEX, 4=INT, 5=POW or 6=CHA.
Corroding - Weapons sustain 1d8 damage each time they strike the creature. Weapon Armour Points offer no protection.
Dampener - All magical effects within the creature’s POW in metres are suppressed by 1d8 Magnitude. Spells reduced to zero Magnitude are dispelled unless part of a permanent enchantment.

Deathly - Drains the vitality of nearby plants and creatures. Those in Short range of the creature must succeed in an unopposed Endurance roll each round to avoid suffering 1 point of damage to every Hit Location, ignoring armour.

Disturbing - Creature is covered with unsettling forms, such as miniature arms, multiple eyes or mouths, writhing pseudopods, etc. Viewers must succeed in an unopposed Willpower test or be helpless with horror until they can make the roll successfully.
Domineering - Manipulates those around it with mental commands, which cannot be resisted unless the target is successful in an unopposed Willpower test.
Draining - Temporarily weakens the magical power of an opponent, draining 1d8 MP with each successful strike.
Droning - Produces a buzzing noise that sedates listeners. All within the creature’s POW x5 in metres must succeed in an unopposed Willpower roll to avoid falling asleep for 1d8 minutes.
Entangle - Restricts the movements of those within melee range, who must succeed in an unopposed Brawn roll to avoid being rendered physically helpless each round.
Frightening - Creature appears terrifyingly dangerous; viewers must succeed in an unopposed Willpower roll or flee the creature immediately.
Icy - Radiates freezing waves of cold, injuring anyone within melee range; roll 1d4, 1=1d2, 2=1d4, 3=1d6 and 4=1d8 damage per round.
Intangible - Moves through solid objects as though non-corporeal. Whilst intangible it cannot be harmed, but neither can it attack.
Leaper - Has powerfully sprung limbs, multiplying its jump range by a factor of 1d4+1.
Levitating -Hovers above the ground giving it the ability to move over any surface without sinking or leaving tracks.
Mimic - Assumes the shape of a creature it successfully touches, maintaining its own Characteristics, but mimicking the locations and appearance of the being contacted.
Mournful - Appearance is sad or pathetic. Observers must succeed in an unopposed Willpower roll to be able to begin attacking it.
Mutated - Roll a random location and remove it from the creature. It no longer has this location, but it still functions perfectly well without it, even defying logic.
Nerveless - Does not feel any pain, and ignores the effects of Serious Wounds.
Neutralising - Any spells cast at the creature are immediately neutralized.
Obfuscating - Produces a cloud of mist, spores or darkness that blinds observers. Those affected must succeed in an unopposed Perception roll every turn to see the creature.
Oversized - One location is swollen doubling its Hit Points.
Paralysing - Renders victims incapable of movement; those touched must succeed in an unopposed Endurance roll to avoid 1d8 minutes of paralysis.

Perceptive - Possesses an odd primary sense; roll a d6, 1=Echolocation (sonar), 2=Thermoception (heat), 3=Cerebralception (sapient consciousness), 4=Nociception (pain), 5=Ethoception (souls), 6=Thaumaception (magic). The creature does not rely on sight to perceive others and may lack eyes.
Poisonous - One unarmed attack inflicts a venomous poison with a delay of 1d8 rounds and a potency of CONx5%, which inflicts a Poison Condition selected from page 113.

Polymorph - Changes shape every round, maintaining its Characteristics, but assuming the locations of the new form and carrying over any damage already suffered (Games Masters should prepare various forms in advance).
Projector - Any damage inflicted on the creature is felt by anyone within POW metres, who suffer the psychological, but not physical effects as if they had been wounded too.
Quick - Movement rate is multiplied by a factor of 1d4+1.
Reflecting -All magic cast on the creature is reflected back against the caster.
Regenerating - Recovers 1 Hit Point per round to every location, unless the creature has suffered a Major Wound in the injured location.
Roaring - Produces a thunderous roar, deafening listeners, who must succeed in an unopposed Endurance roll to avoid becoming temporally stunned for 1d3 Turns.
Scintillating - Possesses a shifting chromatic aura that confuses onlookers. All attacks against the creature are one grade harder.
Shadowy - The creature absorbs the ambient light in its immediate surroundings, creating a pool of total darkness with a radius equal to POW in metres.

Shocking - Charges itself with electricity, inflicting a shock on those that hit it (if using metal or uninsulated weapons, or are struck by it; roll 1d4, 1=1d2, 2=1d4, 3=1d6 and 4=1d8 damage per blow).
Silent - Completely inaudible – even its attacks.
Slimy - Cannot be grappled or gripped in close combat. The creature leaves a sticky mucus trail wherever it travels.
Stench - Releases nauseating odours that sicken inhalers, who must succeed in an unopposed Endurance roll to avoid uncontrollable vomiting for 1d3 Combat Rounds.
Sticky - Secretes a strong glue or mucus which causes items to stick to its skin, requiring a successful unopposed Brawn roll and a Combat Action to free.
Teleporter - Can freely teleport to a new location once per round. The location must be within a number of metres equal to POW x2.

Transmuter -Changes the substance of organic material it touches into another substance; living victims must succeed in an unopposed Endurance roll to avoid the struck location being changed into crystal, dust, stone, wine, bronze and so on.
Vampiric - Hit Point damage inflicted on an opponent is transferred to itself, healing any wounds currently suffered.
Warded - Invulnerable to one specific type of material; steel, wood, stone, flesh, etc.
Weakening - Temporarily reduces the STR of an opponent by 1d8 each successful (undefended) hit.
Blotches CHA -1 per attack. Red blotches on skin
Joint Rot - Strike Rank -1 per attack. At 0 joints freeze
Creeping Crudd - Minus -5% to all activities
Brittleskin - Adds 2 AP to affected hit location -2 to CHA. Requires repair and healing to recover. Irritation requires Endurance roll to keep armor on location or cannot do more than scratch
Convulsions - incapcitating attackes. Endurance roll to be able to do any activities
Slow Withers - Minus 1 HP on the location.
Bleeding Disease - halves the healing effects
Plague - Minus 1d3 STR and CON per attack
Permanent Avert vs magical attacks from members of Fire/Sky cultists
Sprout ram's horns. Use to butt like broo for 1d6 damage
Skin/fur turns pitch black. +20 to hide/stealth skills in darkness
Eat the flesh of sentient creatures at every meal
Always eat the flesh of every victim
Never speak to members of other two cult aspects
Kill all non-Thanatari sentient chaos beings encountered
Never speak in presence of non-Thanatari
Never go into sunlight or blindness may result. Rol under CONx5 or be permanently blinded
Never go into torchlight or CONx5 . fail blindness
Never go into non Darklight or CONx5 . fail blindness
Never use fire in any form including creation of Darklight
Accept Curse of Thed chaotic feature
Always attack Storm Bull worshippers and fight to death
Never eat plant life, except elves
Never wear metal except tarnished silver
Never eat the flesh of any cloven hooved animal
Always attack Lhankhor Mhy cultist and fight to death
Never lie to a fellow Thanatari
Never cast an offensive magic spell (ritual spells can still be used)
Autonomy - Fetch can venture beyond the shaman’s aura of influence, i.e. his POW in metres. This allows the fetch to act as an independent scout or messenger.
Binding - Can bind one spirit, holding it upon the Spirit Plane without the necessity of a fetish.

Cannibalistic - Fetch gains the ability to regenerate Magic Points by absorbing the essence of other spirits it has access to or has defeated in Spirit Combat. It gains 1 Magic Point per Intensity of the consumed spirit.
Comprehension - Grants the shaman the ability to understand and speak with animals of the cult’s totem.
Conjugated - Autonomy - The fetch and shaman gain a permanent mental link, permitting mental communication over any distance.
Covert - Fetch gains the Stealth skill at 50%+INT+CHA. It can hide from active magical or spiritual observation, by opposing the Perception skill of the observer.
Deadly - Can either Dissipate or Sunder a spirit it has beaten in Spirit Combat.
Domination - Grants the shaman the ability to command all living animals of the cult’s totem within the fetch’s POW in metres.
Elemental - Manifestation - abilities of an Elemental spirit of equal Intensity (assuming it is manifested in the physical world).
Mana - shaman can draw upon the fetch’s Magic Points, but does not regenerate any lost points until the shaman pays them back.
Manifestation -  manifest itself in the physical world. This costs 1 Magic Point and lasts for its POW in minutes.

Perception - shaman can see spirits, souls and magical auras in his immediate vicinity without needing to enter a trance. This benefit ceases if the fetch moves away from the shaman or manifests in the physical world.
Persistent - Fetch gains immunity to magical dismissal of any form.
Possession - Fetch gains the ability to Possess others – normally an animal of the cult’s totem or the shaman’s body whilst he is discorporate, protecting it from harm.
Sagacity - Fetch gains one extra skill at 100%+(INTx2). This is usually a knowledge based lore, but can be a physical skill if the fetch has the Possession ability.
Shapechange - Manifestation - Fetch gains the ability to shape change the shaman into his cult’s totem animal, as per Shape-shifting spirits.
Spellcasting - Fetch gains the Folk Magic skill at 50%+POW+CHA and can cast any Folk Magic spell the shaman knows.
Warding - Manifestation - Guardian spirit of equal Intensity (assuming it is capable of manifesting itself in the physical world).
Boost Attribute - Strike Rank by value of intensity
Insubstantial. Able to become insubstantial at will in 1-round increments; must re-solidify to attack. Able to cast and be affected by spells and spirits while insubstantial.
Healing blood. Blood is Heal 6 potion, 3d6+6 doses. Automatically activated, one dose at a time, when injured.
never use a mace or maul of any kind
Never wear any leather armor on legs
Party tags
fields.description: Parties can now be tagged.

fields.name: Tagging
fields.description: Templates can be tagged now. When adding a tag, a list of existing tags is shown. Filtering was changed to happen based on tags.

fields.name: Support for animism
fields.description: Added the skills Binding and Trance to the templates and support for spirits. Spirits are otherwise normal enemy templates, except that they have Spirit for race. The Spirit-race lacks the physical attributes. Spirits can be associated with animists the same way as sorcerers and theists get their spells.

fields.name: Theist devotional pool
fields.description: Added the devotional pool to theists.

fields.name: Hide irrelevant spells
fields.description: Irrelevant spells for the npc are hidden in the template edit view. If the template doesn't have Shaping, Exhort or Folk Magic skill, Sorcery spells, Theistic miracles and Folk magic spells are hidden respectively.

fields.name: Miracle max intensity
fields.description: Added maximum miracle intensity for theists.

fields.name: Group template
fields.description: Added new feature: Group templates. Group is basically a collection of templates, where each template can be generated one or more times when generating the group.

fields.name: PDF export
fields.description: Added possibility to export the generated NPC's/monsters as PDF.

fields.name: Statistics
fields.description: Added a page with some simple statistics about the most popular templates and races.

fields.name: Notes field
fields.description: Added notes field to the templates.

fields.name: Cloning
fields.description: Added a feature to clone existing templates.

fields.name: Custom skills
fields.description: Added possibility to add customs skills to the templates.

fields.name: Chaotic features
fields.description: Added simple support for chaotic features. Simple support means, that the monsters with a chaotic feature only get a text description of the feature. Possible modifications to Characteristics, skills or other attributes are not included in the stats.

fields.name: Additional features
fields.description:
Added support for generic additional features. To add an additional feature to your template, select it from the list, click add and give it some probability. Note, that you can add one feature several times.

Currently only admins and selected superusers can create new Feature specifications.

fields.name: First release
fields.description: First version of the tool published.

fields.name: Sorcery support
fields.description: Added support for sorcery.

fields.name: Sorting and filtering
fields.description: Added functionality for simple sorting and filtering.

fields.name: Custom spells
fields.description: It's possible now to add custom spells to your templates.

fields.name: Custom weapons
fields.description: It's now possible to add custom weapons to your templates.

fields.name: New additional features
fields.description:
The range of additional features now includes
  • Attitudes
  • Chaotic features
  • Abilities for Curse spirits
  • Abilities for Nature spirits
  • Abilities for Fetches
  • Diseases
  • Appearance for Lunar NPC's
  • Appearance for Teleos NPC's
  • Appearance for Western NPC's
  • Monster Island High Folk culture
  • Monster Island tribe
  • Personal secrets for NPC's
  • Thanatar Geas
  • Thantar gifts

fields.name: Additional features for Parties
fields.description: Added support for additional features for Parties. Actual features are yet to be added.

fields.name: Several small updates
fields.description:
Several small fixes including:
  • Natural armor no longer increases armor penalty. Natural armor is calculated assuming, that the armor defined in the race specifications is natural armor. In other words, only armor above the natural armor counts towards armor penalty.
  • When cloning a Template, also the additional features are cloned now.
  • Improved the selection of templates in the Index page.
  • The maximum number as well as maximum POW of controllable spirits is now being shown for Animists.

fields.name: New additional features for enemies
fields.description:
• Clothing Coloring - Pamaltelan
  • Cover Role/disguise
  • Distinguishing Feature
  • Dwarven Item
  • Exotic Poison
  • Fonritan Free Women Clothing
  • Fonritan Freemen clothing
  • Fonritan Freemen Clothing Detail
  • Fonritian Appearance
  • Fonritian Slave Clothing
  • Kareeshtu Clothing
  • Lanbril Item
  • Malformity
  • Pocharngo's Corruption

fields.name: New Additional Features for Parties
fields.description:
• Attitude
  • Dwarven item
  • Fatigue State
  • Mission
  • Monster Island High Folk Culture
  • Monster Island Tribe
  • Pamaltelan/Monster Island Trade Item
  • Pirate Ship
  • Sailor Nation
  • Situation/activity
  • Teleos Appearance
  • Trade Goods

fields.name: Enemy/NPC names
fields.description: Added support for NPC random names. When specifying the template, you can select a namelist for the template. When the enemies are being generated based on the template, each enemy gets a random name from the list. Current lists include names for Orlanthi, Monster Island residents and Generic Fantasy, and more are on their way. If you have a name list you'd like to add, drop me a note.

fields.name: Elementals
fields.description: Added support for elementals. To create a new elemental, select Elemental from the race list. Note: The calculation of the elemental hit points relies on POW being entered in format used in the rulebook, eg. 1d6+12 for Intensity 4.

fields.name: Mysticism
fields.description: Added support for mysticism. To start creating mystics, create a new template, add the skills Meditations and Mysticism to it and select the talents. If you can't see the talent list after adding the skills, hit F5 to force the browser to reload javascript.

fields.name: Do you feel lucky?
fields.description: Added "Do you feel lucky?" -button. Clicking the button will generate 6 instances of a randomly picked enemy based on the current filter.

fields.name: New party and enemy features
fields.description:
New Enemy features:
  • Humakti gifts and geases
  • Yelmalio gifts and geases
  • Elemental spirit abilities
  • Sorcerer items
New Party features:
  • Monster Island Standard events
  • Monster Island Special events
  • Monster Island weather
  • Jungle Temperature
  • Jungle Traps
  • Jungle Terrain Feature
  • Generic encounter featuers
  • Rumors and Old Tales in Pavis

fields.name: New party and enemy features
fields.description:
New Enemy features:
  • Combat Style Trait
  • Sartar Tribe
  • Lightbringer Tribe in Prax
  • Monster Island Brotherhood
  • Monster Island Warrior Style
  • Pavis Noble Family
New Party features:
  • Pavis Noble Family
  • Sartar Tribe

fields.name: New party and enemy features
fields.description:
Party features
  • Sartar rumors
  • Spy mission target
  • Mission (Spy)
  • Sea special events
  • Sea standard events
  • Sea weather
Enemy features
  • Gift (secret teaching)
  • Seven winds spirit society
  • Chalk Man spirit society
  • Madness
  • Spit snake subtype

fields.name: Fixed Reset Password -email
fields.description: The link in the Reset Password -email had broken at some stage. Fixed now. So you are welcome to forget your passwords again.

fields.name: Editable enemy names
fields.description: You can now edit the names of generated enemies by clicking on the name.

fields.name: Editable notes
fields.description: Now also notes (both party notes and enemy notes) can be edited. You probably need to hit F5 once to refresh javascript for the feature to work.

fields.name: Favorites
fields.description: New feature: You can star templates to mark them as favorites. To see all your starred templates, use the filter. Note! You need to register and log in for the feature to be available.

fields.name: New home page
fields.description: The home page has been redesigned to scale better with the growing amount of templates. It's now a light-weight landing page with search functionality. In addition, if the user is logged in, it shows the favorite/starred templates of the user.

fields.name: Cults
fields.description: Added support for cults. A cult is basically a collection of spells and spirits. The spells of the cult are added to the generated enemy.

fields.name: Filter by rank
fields.description: Added possibility to filter by rank to the Home-page search.

fields.name: Filtering out
fields.description: You can now filter Templates out using the Search functionality by adding a '-' before the search term. For example to see all Monster Island creatures, except the ones that are related to sea, enter "Monster Island -sea" (without the quotes).

fields.name: Weapon groups
fields.description: Added support for weapon groups and weapons of Monster Island and Mythic Britain.
